intro: Hieracium cirritum subsp. ustulatum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive yellowish-green color, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in temperate climates and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
